answers.question: What is the chemical formula and molecular weight of riboflavin?
answers.answer:
Riboflavin, also known as Vitamin B2, has the chemical formula \( \text{C}_{17}\text{H}_{20}\text{N}_{4}\text{O}_{6} \).

To calculate the molecular weight of riboflavin, we sum the atomic weights of all the atoms in its formula:

- Carbon (C): 12.01 g/mol
- Hydrogen (H): 1.008 g/mol
- Nitrogen (N): 14.01 g/mol
- Oxygen (O): 16.00 g/mol
